alert.note: Alert for Eastern Greenbrier; Monroe; Summers; Western Greenbrier (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 16 at 5:50PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Greenbrier, eastern Summers and northwestern Monroe Counties through 615 PM EDT... At 550 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Ballengee, or 7 miles southeast of Hinton, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Lewisburg... Ronceverte... Alderson... Red Sulphur Spring... Asbury... Greenbrier River Trail... and Buck. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Greenbrier; Monroe; Summers; Western Greenbrier
